markdownRemark.excerpt: Hi there!  When I first started to learn to code, I did not want to spend any money (i.e., no online courses or real-life courses) as I thought it would be…
markdownRemark.html:
Hi there!

When I first started to learn to code, I did not want to spend any money (i.e., no online courses or real-life courses) as I thought it would be 1) more fulfilling to learn by myself 2) have higher monetary returns.

I would say that a main bulk or debugging, or learning how to code, requires you to google A LOT. By a lot, I mean clicking on almost every link that appears on the first 2 pages of Google, or even googling in another language. As I’m based in Japan, my google searches appear in Japanese and I do read the Japanese version of StackOverflow.

frontmatter.title: Resources that helped me
frontmatter.description: Resources that I've used when I started to learn to code
